rdf:Description.dc:title: Indian Campaign of 1832 Map of Indian war of 1832
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Rose, Edwin, 1807-1864
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Black Hawk War (1832); Indians of North America; Sauk Indians
rdf:Description.dc:description: Covers region in northern Illinois and southern Wisconsin roughly bounded by Lake Winnebago, the Kankakee River, Peoria, and Prairie du Chien. Identifies rivers, forts, towns, and distances between points. Details routes taken by U.S. forces during the Black Hawk War of 1832. Shows Gen. Henry Atkinson's June 28-July 9 route from Dixon's Ferry northeast along the Rock River and Lt. Col. Abraham Eustis's August 1-September 1 route from Chicago to Rock Island. Also identifies marshes of the upper Rock River where Sauk Indians led by Black Hawk were based and their retreat northwest from the Wisconsin River. Scale approximately 1:1,675,000.
rdf:Description.dc:format: 1 manuscript map; 244 x 201 mm Manuscript maps; Maps; Manuscripts tiff
rdf:Description.dc:identifier:
VAULT Ruggles 408
NL000068_o2.jpg
rdf:Description.dc:relation: Rudy Lamont Ruggles Collection (Newberry Library) Chicago and the Midwest (Newberry Library)

rdf:Description.dc:title: A map of Chicago's gangland from authentic sources
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Bruce-Roberts, Inc.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Crime; Gangs
rdf:Description.dc:description: Map of Chicago gang locations showing Little Italy, Little Sicily, Cicero, Capone Territory, Westside O'Donnell Territory, Stickney, Saltis Territory, Southside O'Donnell Territory, and Little Africa. "Designed to inculcate the most important principles of piety and virtue in young persons, and graphically portray the evils and sin of large cities." Numbers in red circles give the sequence of important events in Chicago's gangland war. Insets include: Mrs. O'Leary's cow, lawyer running to spring his client, an armored car, bootleggers stealing wheels from prohibition cars, machine gunners arriving from Detroit, World's Fair grounds of 1933, police tipping over a speakeasy, and ""gangland dictionary"".
rdf:Description.dc:format: 1 map: colored; 48 x 62 cm Maps tiff
rdf:Description.dc:source: Chicago: Bruce-Roberts, Inc. Digital image scanned from original map
rdf:Description.dc:relation: Chicago and the Midwest (Newberry Library)

rdf:Description.dc:title: Lloyd's map of the lower Mississippi from St. Louis to the Gulf of Mexico Map of the lower Mississippi River from St. Louis to the Gulf of Mexico
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Lloyd, James T.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Real property; Landowners
rdf:Description.dc:description: Strip map printed in 5 vertical sections (86 x 26 cm or smaller). "Exhibiting the sugar and cotton plantations, cities, towns, landings, sand bars, islands, bluffs, bayous, cut-offs, the steamboat channel, mileage, fortifications, railroads, &c. along the river." Shows land ownership and tracts, distances from New Orleans to St. Louis in five mile increments, roads, towns, county boundaries, railroads, notable physical features, and layout of larger cities. Relief shown by hachures and pictorially.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Bowen, Barton W. Stone, 1829 or 1830-1868; Bowen, William, 1836-1893; United States. Topographical Bureau
rdf:Description.dc:format: 1 map in 5 segments: hand colored; on sheet 97 x 133 cm Maps; Hand coloring tiff

rdf:Description.dc:title: Contents page

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 007
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 007. Statistics from census of 1870.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 008-9
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 008-9. Drawn by D.W. Ensign. Published by Brink, McCormick & Co. Scale 14 miles to the inch.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 010
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 010. Contents: Brief sketch of Sangamon County -- Organization of Menard County, something of its wealth and advantages -- The early settlement of the county, its pioneers, early agricultural and horticultural matters.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 011
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 011. Continues from page 10: The early settlement of the county, its pioneers, early agricultural and horticultural matters. Additional contents: The early officials of the county, miscellaneous matters -- Early churches and ministers -- Navigation of the Sangamon River, history of Menard County railroads -- Menard County and the Mexican War -- Menard County Agricultural Society -- Sketch of Petersburg.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 012
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 012. ""Showing an outline of the county and its subdivisions into congressional and civil T.P., a general outline of timber together with the locations of the towns and villages, post offices, churches, school houses, streams, roads &c &c."" Drawn by W.L. Perce.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 013
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 013

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 014
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 014. Continues from page 13: Sketch of Petersburg.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 015
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 015. Concludes from page 14-14: Sketch of Petersburg. Additional contents: Sketch of the ""rise and fall"" of Salem, the early home of Abraham Lincoln -- Sketch of Athens -- Sketch of Tallula -- Sketch of Greenview -- Robinson's Mills.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 016
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 016. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000. Torn with loss of most of title.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 017
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 017. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 018
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 018. Contents: Sweetwater -- Oakford -- Atterberry -- History of townships. Petersburg precinct -- Tallula precinct -- Indian Creek precinct -- Athens precinct -- Sandridge precinct -- Sweetwater precinct -- Greenview precinct -- Rock Creek precinct.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 019
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 019. List of sponsors of the atlas. Lists name, post office, residence, business, nativity, and when the sponsor came to Menard County. Names are arranged by township and range.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 020
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 020. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000. Inset: Plat map of Athens. Scale 400 ft. to the inch.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 021
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 021. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 022
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 022. List of sponsors of the atlas. Lists name, post office, residence, business, nativity, and when the sponsor came to Menard county. Names are arranged by township and range.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 023
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 023. List of sponsors of the atlas. Lists name, post office, residence, business, nativity, and when the sponsor came to Menard county. Names are arranged by township and range.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 024
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 024. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 025
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 025. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000. Inset: Plat map of Tallula. Scale 400 ft. to the inch.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 026
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 026. List of sponsors of the atlas. Lists name, post office, residence, business, nativity, and when the sponsor came to Menard county. Names are arranged by township and range.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 027
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 027. Includes first part of a biographical sketch of William G. Greene.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 028
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 028. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 029
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 029. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 030
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 030. Concludes a biographical sketch of William G. Greene.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 031
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 031. Includes biographical sketches of Harry Riggin and George Kirby and first part of sketch of Milem Alkire.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 032
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 032. Shows numbered lots and names of property owners. Scale approximately 1:31,000.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 033
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 033. Contents: Plat of Sweetwater -- Plat of Atterbury -- Plat of Robinsons Mills -- Plat of Oakford -- Plat of Greenview, Ill.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 034
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 034. Continues biographical sketch of Milem Alkire. Includes biographical sketches of John Bennett, John Tice, Malkom Hubly, and Fred Wilkinson, and first part of sketch of Cornelius Rourke.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 035
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 035. Concludes biographical sketch of Cornelius Rourke. Includes biographical sketches of Dr. F.P. Antle, John B. Harris, Leonard Alkire, and John Kennedy Kincaid, and first part of sketch of Fleming Hall.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 036-37
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 036-37. Contents: View of Tallula from the observatory -- Side view of residence -- Avenue in front of residence -- Public Spirit R.R. Enterprises -- Enterprise Petersburg Woolen Factory -- Discovery coal shaft -- Reliance agriculture -- Old barn -- Anthony & Jim -- New barn.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 038
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 038. Concludes biographical sketch of Fleming Hall. Includes biographical sketches of Thomas Primm, Franklin Wiseman, William Primm, Wolfgang Feulner, William F. Council, Jonathan Miller, and Albert G. Nance.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 039
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 039. Includes biographical sketches of Captain Robert Hornback, Russell Godbey, Robert Clary, Andrew Houghton, Gregory Lukins, and Richard Batterton, and the first part of sketch of William Yoakum.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 040-41
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 040-41. Views: North view from the barn observatory -- Residence, north view -- Farm place of Frank V. Alkire -- Tenement house, north west quarter -- Barn, south east view. -- Barn, north west view -- Nine yearlings, Boyer pasture -- Artificial lake, summer evening scene -- Interior view of barn, Sheep shearing.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 042
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 042. Concludes biographical sketch of William Yoakum. Includes biographical sketches of Daniel C. Primm (deceased), G.J. Nybroe, Andrew Gaddie, John B. Copper, David G. Jones, Peter Graham, and William Shaver (deceased), and first part of sketch of John Johnson.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 043
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 043. Contents: Lincoln's early home in Illinois -- Lincoln's home in Springfield -- Grocery sold by W.G. Greene to Abe Lincoln, Salem, Menard Co., Ill. -- Ruins of Salem Hotel, Lincolns boarding house. Includes portraits of Harry and M.L. Riggen.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 044
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 044. Views of two large brick residences and their grounds. People play croquet among trees.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 045
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 045. Contents: Farm view -- Country residence -- Petersburg residence, C.M. Ginn, builder.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 046
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 046. Concludes biographical sketch of John Johnson. Includes biographical sketches of Colin M. Robertson, M.D., Hon. Nathaniel W. Branson, Clairborne Hall, Isaac Fulton, and Eli Hartley (deceased).

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 048-49
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 048-49. Contents: Residence, north side -- Milt's place -- Lady Moscow, Pacer -- John's place -- Family cemetery -- Residence, south east view -- Spring Lake -- A view of the Sangamon River, east side of the farm -- Field lot watering place.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 052-53
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 052-53. Contents: East view -- The ""Col."" -- South view -- Residence -- View on the bottom pasture -- Andy Johnson -- Gen. Grant -- The old homestead -- Tenant house and brickyard.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 056-57
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 056-57. Contents: Feeding -- Tenant house no. 3, home farm -- Tenant house no. 1, walnut grove -- Weighing -- Tenant house no. 6, home farm -- Tenant house no. 4, home farm -- Tenant house no. 1, home farm -- Tenant house no. 1, prairie farm -- Tenant house no. 2, walnut grove -- Tenant house no. 2, home farm.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 060-61
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 060-61. Contents: Rosemary Farm -- House & barn -- View of proposed Miriam Park in honor of my mother -- Glosters Beauty -- Sudies -- Grove Napier -- Fairy Grotto -- Crown Prince of Oakland and Countess of Warwick -- Duchess of York 10th & calf and Duke Napier.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 064
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 064. Bust portraits of Leonard Alkire, born Dec. 24th 1785, Milem Alkire, and Eliza J. Alkire.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 065
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 065. Bust portraits of Doctor and Mrs. F.P Antle and George and Dorcus Kirby.

rdf:Description.dc:title: Page 068-69
rdf:Description.dc:description: Page 068-69. Contents: On north farm -- North pasture -- Looking south from the old log cabin, 100 acres -- Looking north from the veranda.
